results.title: The Long journey
results.creator_credit: Rank Screen Services and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: War has left its mark on Korea. Three million refugees joined the ranks of the homeless and hungry and the countryside was maimed and scarred. This film tells of Kim Tai Yung, a farmer from North Korea and one of those refugees who made their way to the South and freedom in 1951. As a background to Kim’s gradual progress the task of United Nations rehabilitation and reconstruction is seen to take shape and move into action.

results.title: Mermaids, or Aiden in Wonderland

constellations_other.name: Indigenous futurisms
constellations_other.description: An exploration of works that put First Peoples futurisms first.

results.description: Mermaids, or Aiden in Wonderland is a powerful intervention in contemporary debates about the future present of climate change, extractive capitalism, and industrial toxicity from the point of view of Indigenous worlds.
description_for_label: Mermaids, or Aiden in Wonderland is a powerful intervention in contemporary debates about the future present of climate change, extractive capitalism, and industrial toxicity from the point of view of Indigenous worlds.

results.title: A Song of air
results.brief_description: An autobiographical account of a daughter’s relationship with her father from the interior of a “typical” Australian family of the 1950’s. Using original 16mm home movie footage filmed by her father, she speaks by means of voice-over of his severe religious and patriarchal oppression, and her resistance to his values and expectations.

results.title: Printer light play
results.brief_description: A study on the technical properties of film colour. Shot on Eastman colour negative, the film records a variety of combinations of the printer lights, blue, red and green, thus creating different colour effects with the subject, a boy holding a Kodak colour control card.

results.title: Experiments in three colour separation
results.brief_description: A documentary of the work of Arthur and Corinne Cantrill since 1975 in 3-colour separation. Discusses the classic theories and principles in 3-colour separation in film and photography. Commentary by Arthur Cantrill.

results.title: A Year to Remember 1953
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1953 - Deaths of Stalin and Queen Mary - Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II - US Vice President Nixon visits Australia - Testing of the Jindivik at Woomera - Mt Everest conquered by Sir Edmund Hillary and Tensing - Anzac Day in Korea - Exchange of POW’s - Express train crash in New Zealand - Davis Cup wins by Lew Hoad and Ken Rosewall - Ben Hogan wins British Open … and much more. Rated: G
results.description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1953 - Deaths of Stalin and Queen Mary - Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II - US Vice President Nixon visits Australia - Testing of the Jindivik at Woomera - Mt Everest conquered by Sir Edmund Hillary and Tensing - Anzac Day in Korea - Exchange of POW’s - Express train crash in New Zealand - Davis Cup wins by Lew Hoad and Ken Rosewall - Ben Hogan wins British Open … and much more. results.title: US Navy Ciné-Kodak Special
results.brief_description: Eastman Kodak introduced the Ciné-Kodak Special in 1933. The silent 16mm camera was durable and lightweight enough to be used by combat photographers working in the field and Kodak manufactured a military version in all-black without the usual chrome edges.

constellations_primary.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_primary.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

results.description: Footage captured during war has the ability to give audiences a sense of what is happening in combat, documenting the frontlines with an unflinching lens and bearing witness to atrocities. Yet it can also be used as propaganda to enlist forces, making it a powerful tool. Eastman Kodak introduced the Ciné-Kodak Special in 1933 following on from its earlier model the Ciné-Kodak in 1923. The silent 16mm camera was durable and lightweight enough to be used by combat photographers working in the field and Kodak manufactured a military version in all-black without the usual chrome edges.
description_for_label: Footage captured during war has the ability to give audiences a sense of what is happening in combat, documenting the frontlines with an unflinching lens and bearing witness to atrocities. Yet it can also be used as propaganda to enlist forces, making it a powerful tool. Eastman Kodak introduced the Ciné-Kodak Special in 1933 following on from its earlier model the Ciné-Kodak in 1923. The silent 16mm camera was durable and lightweight enough to be used by combat photographers working in the field and Kodak manufactured a military version in all-black without the usual chrome edges.
